definition: (prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: In Nigeria's press, Cecilia Ibru is referred to as the First Lady of Banking.
sentences.chinese: 在尼日利亚新闻界，伊布鲁被称为银行界第一夫人。

sentences.english: And we love self-deprecating humor like we saw from the First Lady," says Mr. Lichtman.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢第一夫人那种自我解嘲的幽默。

sentences.english: She became the First Lady of the United States in nineteen ninety-three.
sentences.chinese: 她成为在九三年的美国第一夫人。

sentences.english: But everybody is clamouring for the First Lady.
sentences.chinese: 但大家一致拥戴第一夫人。

sentences.english: One of the most popular attractions at the Smithsonian is a First Ladies exhibit featuring some of their fashions throughout the years.
sentences.chinese: 第一夫人们一直都是服装界密切观察的对象。

sentences.english: Promoting literacy is one of Laura Bush's main projects as first lady.
sentences.chinese: 推广读写能力是萝拉身为第一夫人的主要计画。

sentences.english: She became first lady of the United States in nineteen ninety-three, after Bill Clinton was elected president.
sentences.chinese: 她成为在九三年美国第一夫人，在克林顿当选总统。

sentences.english: And we love self- deprecating humor like we saw from the First Lady, " says Mr."
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢第一夫人那种自我解嘲的幽默。

sentences.english: Margo changes swiftly into a first-lady-of-the-theater manner.
sentences.chinese: 玛歌迅速地换成“戏剧第一夫人”的那副举止神态。

sentences.english: At least one political analyst finds the First Lady something of a cipher.
sentences.chinese: 很多分析家认为第一夫人简直就是一个难解之谜。

sentences.english: Michelle Obama is the most fashion-friendly first lady.
sentences.chinese: 她是史上最爱时尚的第一夫人？

sentences.english: Amelia Earhart had become the first lady of the air.
sentences.chinese: 阿米莉亚埃尔哈特已成为第一夫人的空气。

sentences.english: My mother took my arm as if she were the First Lady.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈挽着我的手臂，宛如第一夫人。

sentences.english: For how many years was Dolley Madison the first lady?
sentences.chinese: 多莉麦迪逊身居第一夫人有多少年的时间？

sentences.english: In fact I'd guess even the first lady might have trouble telling them apart.
sentences.chinese: 说真的，我猜连第一夫人都可能会真假难辨。

sentences.english: The East Wing of the White House principally serves as offices for the First Lady and her staff.
sentences.chinese: 东翼为第一夫人及其工作人员的办公室。

pinyin: Jie2 kui2 lin2 · Ken3 ni2 di2

definition: Elysée Palace, the residence of the president of the French Republic
to swear the oath of office
Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Hillary (name)/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Emmanuel Macron (1977-), president of France from 2017
